description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
age presented in years – see metadata for source of age
species of individuals participating in the study -bonobo/chimpanzee/gorilla/orangutan
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical
whether the participant exchanged initial food item or not
whether size of the reward was obtained
visible probability of receiving more food
real probability of receiving more food
the number of visible large rewards (from 0 to 6)

the level of information- risky (participant could see all potential outcomes)/predictably advantageous (participants could not see but could infer that the covered cups contained large rewards)/ predictably disadvantageous (participants could not see but could infer that the covered cups contained small rewards)/ ambiguous (participants could not guess the exact probabilities associated with potential outcomes)
size of the outcome received at the previous trial (big/medium/small-sized cracker or none in the case of the first trial of the session)
